title: Sanitough
author: Sanitough
content: Bitcoin has been around for 16 years since Satoshi created it, and while much has changed, especially on the regulatory aspects, we can't forget how it impacted our lives. It gave us the opportunity to invest, especially for those who got in early, and to trade actively for profits.If you believe Satoshi is still reading the posts in the forum he founded, now’s your chance to send a message and show your appreciation to the creator. This is the moment to express our gratitude.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Thanks for everything and please don’t over access your Bitcoin stored on wallet address that you owned since Bitcoin community will surely experience a chaos. And if ever you read this, since you are already a billionaire then it will not hurt if you can spare a couple of Bitcoin located on my profile bitcoin address.  Loveyou, Please adopt me.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Sanitough on October 19, 2024, 02:03:38 PMThis is the moment to express our gratitude.I would like to thank him for everything like, creating Bitcoin as a unique decentralized cryptocurrency, developing it well, sharing his genius and deep-thought posts that are still referenced now like "Bitcoin God sayings", and deciding to disappear many years ago. He did great things to create a decentralized currency and disappeared to make it more decentralized.Lastly but most important, I wish him best health and enjoy his life, because if you have good health and a healthy life, you have almost everything.Quote from: dimonstration on October 19, 2024, 02:10:34 PMThanks for everything and please don’t over access your Bitcoin stored on wallet address that you owned since Bitcoin community will surely experience a chaos. Even Satoshi Nakamoto is active online again, the Bitcoin community will be in chaos again. It does not need to have any movement of bitcoins in wallets owned by Satoshi Nakamoto to be chaotic.QuoteAnd if ever you read this, since you are already a billionaireA hypothesis is Satoshi Nakamoto did not sell his bitcoins, so did not sell it, he has yet become a billionaire.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Sanitough on October 19, 2024, 02:03:38 PMIf you believe Satoshi is still reading the posts in the forum he founded, now’s your chance to send a message and show your appreciation to the creator. This is the moment to express our gratitude.My message is thank you for making my friends and young people from my country to have hope and experience true financial freedom in every sense of the word. The young bitcoin community in my country, are an endangered group in the hands of security agencies because we own and believe in bitcoin, nevertheless, we won't let their intimidations and persecutions break our spirits and belief in bitcoin. Thank you.  everything we can to stay Quote from: dimonstration on October 19, 2024, 02:10:34 PMThanks for everything and please don’t over access your Bitcoin stored on wallet address that you owned since Bitcoin community will surely experience a chaos. And if ever you read this, since you are already a billionaire then it will not hurt if you can spare a couple of Bitcoin located on my profile bitcoin address.  Loveyou, Please adopt me.    You are so freaking hilarious. If I he were reading your message right now, he'd probably be laughing his head off. You should have just dropped your bitcoin address in your message that way he wouldn't have to do any clicks to check your profile.

comments.author: Thomas Pellegrino
comments.body: SATOSHI NAKAMOTO are ΛμϞιηα, an advanced civilization from the other side of the unobservable multiverse. They expected Bitcoin to free humanity from material hardship, in a complex bid to save ΛμϞιηα civilization from economic collapse (from hyperexpansion). They didn't understand human nature and learned the hard way. As much as they understood, they didn't expect illegal activities to take over Bitcoin's reputation, in some ways causing human society to degenerate.Since the turn of the 21st century, SATOSHI NAKAMOTO (ΛμϞιηα) worked to lay the foundation for First Contact and reveal themselves to the public, merging interplanetary communities with Earth. They've developed a cyber warfare-proof blockchain dedicated to enriching Bitcoin's original function- Bridge to the Stars.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5513720

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Thank you satoshi and I don’t know if you’ll ever get to see my message but if you ever do, just know that, you’re loved and your legacy will forever live and yes I also stand with @Davidvictorson to say a every big thank you to you for giving our country youth a hope especially in a country like this where it seems there isn’t any hope for the common youth.Thank you satoshiThank you theymosThank you everyone who has also made this community a great place to be

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Nothing more but to tell him to stay in the shadows as he always has. He should make sure not to access his wallet holding those large sum of Bitcoin, it should be considered a donation for the growth of the community just as he has always said. Lastly, I thank and congratulate him for the success of his idea.

comments.author: Thomas Pellegrino
comments.body: SATOSHI says "you're welcome." At least on their part.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5513720

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: If you are still alive and well, go out and vote for Trump. We need every vote we can get. Never say "meeeh my vote is not important" , "meeh I am already rich who cares about the elections", "meeeh I don't live in the US anymoar"These are very lame excuses.If you don't vote for Trump, America is finished and the world war III will begin so every vote counts.

comments.author: jcojci
comments.body: Thank you for creating Bitcoin for us. We are really honored to be part of Bitcoin and we get the benefit of using Bitcoin. I hope you can safely wherever you are and no need to reveal who you are because you will be chased by many parties. No matter if you are one single person or a group of people, you do the right thing for people, whole people because you gave us a chance to have a way to manage our finances by ourselves. Very big thanks from us to you, Satoshi Nakamoto whoever you are.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Dear real Satoshi, please remain anonymous. Don't bother to reveal yourself because there are many claiming to be you. Your reappearance will throw confusion in the industry.Dear Satoshi, incase you are in the forum, reading this post, how about going to your wallet and transfer bitcoin to forum members.Dear Satoshi, incase you are late, RIP. The world will never forget you.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Sanitough on October 19, 2024, 02:03:38 PMIf you believe Satoshi is still reading the posts in the forum he founded, now’s your chance to send a message and show your appreciation to the creator. I will like to PM him since he is online and active back again to the forum, because if a left a comment here on any thread created, he may not be opportune to view or come across the thread and my message would not get to the target receiving end, but using a forum PM will make him aware of someone sending him a message, this may have to be more personal between us, even if he is not active, at least his email will alert him of a bitcointalk notification message, while as regard my wish, i hope he could also spare me some bitcoin as well from his holdings.

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.created_time: October 19, 2024, 07:58:55 PMLast edit: October 19, 2024, 08:10:45 PM by Saint-loup
comments.body: I would ask him why he doesn't come out of the shadows to ask for an evolution of Bitcoin. Bitcoin has become too slow, too expensive, too polluting, and too much limited compared to many other cryptos for being able to eternally stay the king of the cryptocurrencies in the coming years IMO. Besides that, if he doesn't want to use his Bitcoins why he doesn't want to publicly burn them once and for all or to airdrop them to the faithful BTC community.

comments.author: Sonia_123
comments.body: Thank you for saving this generation from financial struggle by giving us liberty and freedom to our funds wherever we find ourselves in the world most especially the youth by empowering them through your wealth of wisdom, today most individual in the world is financially free from their country's economy challenges and limitation to accessibility to funds. Wishing you and your entire team more wisdom and Long life .

comments.author: Miles2006
comments.body: No doubt the world is grateful but mine will be referred as questions, I’m always curious about the fact Satoshi is anonymous probably for security reasons and safety but whatever transpired while creating bitcoin I want Satoshi to know bitcoin enthusiasts will forever embrace and love bitcoin. A lot of people might disagree with the concept of adopting bitcoin but it’s not a must everyone will show concern and that’s normal, due to certain discrimination from the government and others bitcoin still stand as king also Satoshi has created something meaningful in our digital era that’s a huge plan.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: I will tell him that you are the most brilliant man known to humanity, possessing a genius mind. You were able, with your skills, programming experience and unlimited abilities, to create this decentralized financial economic system and this great technology that immortalized your name in this sector. Despite your anonymity, you will remain in our hearts as one of the most important supporters of financial freedom and privacy in the world.Sixteen years have passed in the blink of an eye since you created Bitcoin in 2008, and despite the difficulties that Bitcoin faced, it overcame all of them and broke all barriers. This proves the extent of your invention's competence and its strength as the most important safe investment asset that gained the trust of businessmen, investors, and major companies. Thank you, and thanks to the early Bitcoin developers and everyone who contributed to the shine and brilliance of this digital golden treasure.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: In my case, I would first like to thank Satoshi for dedicating his time to creating Bitcoin, which in my opinion is one of the best innovations of the last 20 years. I know that Musk is creating many interesting things, but in terms of finance, Satoshi has created something extraordinary. Giving each person the opportunity to store their coins in their wallet without having to do KYC and without having to run the risk of the government charging them taxes is a very good thing. Of course, when a person converts to fiat, they may pay taxes depending on the country in which they live. Secondly, I wish that wherever Satoshi is, he is healthy, happy and safe.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: Sanitough on October 19, 2024, 02:03:38 PMBitcoin has been around for 16 years since Satoshi created it, and while much has changed, especially on the regulatory aspects, we can't forget how it impacted our lives. It gave us the opportunity to invest, especially for those who got in early, and to trade actively for profits.If you believe Satoshi is still reading the posts in the forum he founded, now’s your chance to send a message and show your appreciation to the creator. This is the moment to express our gratitude.I would only like to ask a questions, but i would hope i wouldn't ever get an answers, because that would mean satoshi revealing themselves. So maybe i would just say that hopefully satoshi sees all the positive development, and does't think that we have totally missed the point and created a monster of satoshi's "child". And i can't even imagine how much i would bite my fingers as a satoshi, when idiots would kept misconstruing my vision, and use it as a political tool. I hope that you're ok satoshi, and in all kindness, please don't resurface here.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: This is kind of a fun topic. There is a very real chance that Satoshi is checking in on bitcointalk.org here and there.  I highly doubt that they would spend a heck of a lot of time here, but I'm sure they pop in and out here and there (if alive).  Also very real chance they are one of us, chatting with us here and there, and we simply just don't know it.  I mean I would doubt they would do much chatting here, but I could see some.Simply, thank you.

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: Hey Satoshi, how’s it going? Man, not only did you create Bitcoin, but you also gave us this forum. This place opened my eyes to the real world of Bitcoin, and honestly, it changed my life. I’m still here today, reaping the rewards of being part of this space. You have no clue how much it shifted everything for me, from being an employee to now having full control over my finances and running a business built from Bitcoin profits.Wherever you are, no matter who you are, I just want to say thanks for everything. The legacy you left behind is untouchable, not even Trump could shake it. Stay low-key, live your life, and hey, maybe someday you’ll think about airdropping some of your Bitcoins to the top 20 posters in this thread.
